10 Things I've
Learned from
Sass Plugins

Thanks SydCSS for having me.
Today I’d like to talk about Sass.
In particular, I want to talk about some of the learnings that I’ve found useful from reading Framework Source code.

1. Grammar proof your selectors.

Grammar proof your selectors.

We should all know the pain of debugging typos in selectors? This is something that happens a lot !
So, when you’re writing selectors,
Grammar proof your selectors !

2. Chain your import statements.

Chain your import statements.

It’s less annoying, but something always feels wrong about repeating the @import directive. It feels much more natural to chain the import, like chaining JavaScript variables,
well it turns out you can,
Chain import statements !

3. Use objects for configs.

Use objects for configs.

Oh hey, these are some notes. They'll be hidden in your presentation, but you can see them if you open the speaker notes window (hit 's' on your keyboard).

Access the config object with getters and setters.



Oh hey, these are some notes. They'll be hidden in your presentation, but you can see them if you open the speaker notes window (hit 's' on your keyboard).

4. Use lots of Sass Partials.

Use lots of Sass Partials.
